etymologies: early 20th century; earliest use found in Chemical Abstracts. From French planchéite from the name of J. Planche, French traveller and naturalist, who brought the first specimens of the mineral from the Congo + -ite

definitions: A hydrated silicate and hydroxide of copper, Cu₈ Si₈ O₂₂ (OH)₄.H₂ O, found in oxidized copper deposits in the form of blue, fibrous, translucent crystals of the orthorhombic system.
